feed.title: Track Awesome Neuroscience Updates Daily
feed.subtitle: A curated list of awesome neuroscience libraries, software and any content related to the domain.

entry.title: Awesome Neuroscience Updates on Dec 20, 2022
entry.content:
Resources / Ebooks

  • Andy's Brain Book - Book companion to Andy's Brain Blog. Provides an introduction to working in a Unix environment, fMRI analysis, and commonplace neuroimaging tools and topics.
  • NiPraxis - Textbook for the NiPraxis course, covers fundamental concepts in neuroimaging analysis and how they relate to the wider world of statistics, engineering and computer science. Learn how to work with data and code to get a deeper understanding of how fMRI methods work, how they can fail, how to fix them, and how to develop new methods.

Resources / Blogs

  • Andy's Brain Blog - A large collection of articles, tutorials, and videos, covering many of the popular neuroimaging tools and methods.

Resources / Communities

  • neuroimaging@python.org - A list for discussion of neuroimaging analysis in Python. Among other things, this list is home to discussions concerning NiPy projects (including NiBabel, Nilearn, dipy, MNE-Python, and more).

Resources / Miscellaneous

  • NeuroHackademy - Summer school in neuroimaging and data science, held at the University of Washington eScience Institute. Lectures are available through the institute's YouTube channel.

entry.title: Awesome Neuroscience Updates on Aug 08, 2022
entry.content:
Programming / Python

  • NiMARE - NiMARE is a Python package for neuroimaging meta-analyses

Resources / Miscellaneous

  • SORTED (⭐24) - SORTED: a list of interesting science ideas and links (cognitive/neuro & data science)

entry.title: Awesome Neuroscience Updates on Oct 31, 2021
entry.content:
Programming / Python

  • SpikeInterface (⭐619) - Framework designed to unify spike-sorting technologies

Resources / Miscellaneous

  • NeuroElectro - Searchable database of neurons and their electrophysiological properties (extracted from literature)

entry.title: Awesome Neuroscience Updates on Jun 02, 2021
entry.content:
Programming / Matlab

  • Brain Dynamics Toolbox - Open software for simulating dynamical systems in neuroscience.
  • BrainStorm - Open-source application dedicated to the analysis of brain recordings (MEG, EEG, fNIRS, ECoG, depth electrodes and multiunit electrophysiology).
  • EEGLAB - Interactive Matlab toolbox for processing continuous and event-related EEG, MEG and other electrophysiological data.
  • SPM - Free and open source software for the analysis of brain imaging data sequences (fMRI, PET, SPECT, EEG, MEG).

entry.title: Awesome Neuroscience Updates on Apr 15, 2021
entry.content:
Resources / MOOCs

  • Neuromatch Academy (⭐2.8k) - Jupyter notebooks for the three-week intensive summer school in computational neuroscience.

entry.title: Awesome Neuroscience Updates on Jan 06, 2021
entry.content:
Programming / JavaScript

  • jsPsych - Library for creating and running behavioural experiments in a web browser.

Resources / Newsletters

  • BrainPost - A mailing list that delivers weekly easy-to-read summaries of the latest neuroscience publications.

entry.title: Awesome Neuroscience Updates on Oct 03, 2020
entry.content:
Resources / Blogs

  • Neuroskeptic - Discover magazine's neuroscience blog which offers a look at the latest developments in neuroscience, psychiatry and psychology through a critical lens.

Resources / Miscellaneous

  • neuroSummerSchools (⭐223) - List of summer (and seasonal) summer schools in neuroscience and related fields.

entry.title: Awesome Neuroscience Updates on Oct 28, 2019
entry.content:
Programming / Python

  • BindsNET (⭐1.6k) - Package for simulating spiking neural networks for reinforcement & machine learning.

entry.title: Awesome Neuroscience Updates on Oct 01, 2019
entry.content:
Resources / Miscellaneous

  • Brain Matters - Neuroscience podcast where real neuroscientists sit down and talk about the brain.

entry.title: Awesome Neuroscience Updates on Feb 14, 2019
entry.content:
Resources / Miscellaneous

  • McCulloch & Pitts Neural Net Simulator - Simulator for a historical computational model based on neurons.

entry.title: Awesome Neuroscience Updates on Oct 30, 2018
entry.content:
Programming / R

  • nat: NeuroAnatomy Toolbox (⭐68) - Package for the (3D) visualisation and analysis of biological image data, especially tracings of single neurons.
  • brainGraph (⭐186) - Package for performing graph theory analyses of brain MRI data.

Resources / Ebooks

  • Neuronal Dynamics - Open-access electronic textbook that covers computational and theoretical neuroscience. Provided by École Polytechnique Fédérale de Lausanne (EPFL).

Resources / Communities

  • StackExchange - Psychology and neuroscience StackExchange site.

Resources / Newsletters

  • Comp-neuro - A mailing list that is is intended to address the broad range of research approaches and issues involved in the general field of computational neuroscience.

Resources / Miscellaneous

  • Awesome Public Datasets - Neuroscience (⭐64k) - High-quality open neuroscience datasets.

entry.title: Awesome Neuroscience Updates on Jun 03, 2018
entry.content:
Resources / Miscellaneous

  • NeuronDB - Searchable database for of three types of neuronal properties: voltage gated conductances, neurotransmitter receptors, and neurotransmitter substances.

entry.title: Awesome Neuroscience Updates on Jul 07, 2017
entry.content:
Resources / Communities

  • Quora - Neuroscience topic on Quora contains answers, often by experts, to questions ranging from basic to advanced.
  • Reddit - List of neuroscience, psychology and cognitive science subreddits.

entry.title: Awesome Neuroscience Updates on Jun 26, 2017
entry.content:
Resources / Ebooks

  • Computational Cognitive Neuroscience - Text which provides an in-depth introduction to the main ideas in the computational cognitive neuroscience, a field which aims to understand the brain by using biologically based computational models.

Resources / Miscellaneous

  • ModelDB - Searchable database for computational neuroscience models.

entry.title: Awesome Neuroscience Updates on Jun 20, 2017
entry.content:
Resources / Ebooks

  • Neuroscience Online - Open-access electronic textbook and interactive courseware covering neuroscience in depth. Provided by the Department of Neurobiology and Anantomy at the University of Texas Medical School at Houston.

Resources / Miscellaneous

  • Neuroscience Mindmap - Interactive mindmap containing curated resources for anyone interested in learning neuroscience.

entry.title: Awesome Neuroscience Updates on Jun 14, 2017
entry.content:
Programming / C++

  • Brayns (⭐301) - Minimalistic visualiser that can perform ray-traced rendering of neurons. Ray-tracing can help to highlight areas of neural circuits where cells touch each other and where synapses are being created leading to a better understanding of how individual cells and subsequently the brain functions.

Programming / JavaScript

  • Brainbrowser (⭐371) - Library exposing set of web-based 3D visualization tools primarily targetting neuroimaging.

entry.title: Awesome Neuroscience Updates on Jun 10, 2017
entry.content:
Programming / Python

  • Brian2 (⭐1k) - Free, open source simulator for spiking neural networks.

entry.title: Awesome Neuroscience Updates on May 18, 2017
entry.content:
Resources / Blogs

  • The scicurious brain - Maintained by Scientific American, this blog typically covers one research paper in a single entry.
  • Action Potential - Forum operated by neuroscience editors at the journal, Nature.

Resources / MOOCs

  • The Fundamentals of Neuroscience | Harvard & edX - Serves an introductory survery of topics in neuroscience and has no specific prerequisites, though some prior exposure to biology and/or chemistry can be helpful.
  • Computational Neuroscience | Coursera - Provides an introduction to basic computational methods for understanding what nervous systems do and for determining how they function.
  • Medical Neuroscience - Explores the functional organization and neurophysiology of the human central nervous system, while providing a neurobiological framework for understanding human behavior.

entry.title: Awesome Neuroscience Updates on Apr 16, 2017
entry.content:
Programming / Python

  • Nilearn (⭐1.3k) - Module for performing statistical learning/machine learning on NeuroImaging data.
  • DIPY (⭐768) - Toolbox for analysis of MR diffusion imaging.

entry.title: Awesome Neuroscience Updates on Apr 14, 2017
entry.content:
Resources / Blogs

  • The Neurocritic - Often critical takes on the most sensationalistic recent findings in Human Brain Imaging, Cognitive Neuroscience, and Psychopharmacology.

entry.title: Awesome Neuroscience Updates on Apr 10, 2017
entry.content:
Programming / Python

  • expyriment (⭐123) - Platform-independent lightweight Python library for designing and conducting timing-critical behavioural and neuroimaging experiments.

entry.title: Awesome Neuroscience Updates on Apr 06, 2017
entry.content:
Programming / Matlab

  • Psychtoolbox-3 - Free set of Matlab and GNU Octave functions for vision and neuroscience research.

entry.title: Awesome Neuroscience Updates on Apr 05, 2017
entry.content:
Programming / Python

  • Nengo (⭐874) - Library for creating and simulating large-scale brain models.
  • PsychoPy (⭐1.8k) - Package for running psychology and neuroscience experiments. It allows for creating psychology stimuli in Python.
  • NuPic (⭐6.3k) - Numenta Platform for Intelligent Computing is an implementation of Hierarchical Temporal Memory (HTM), a theory of intelligence based strictly on the neuroscience of the neocortex.

Programming / Matlab

  • FieldTrip (⭐907) - Toolbox for MEG and EEG analysis.

entry.title: Awesome Neuroscience Updates on Apr 04, 2017
entry.content:
Programming / Python

  • Nitime (⭐251) - Timeseries analysis for neuroscience data.
  • MNE-Python (⭐3k) - Community-driven software for processing time-resolved neural signals including electroencephalography (EEG) and magnetoencephalography (MEG).
  • NiBabel (⭐713) - Provides read and write access to some common medical and neuroimaging file formats.

Resources / MOOCs

  • Introduction to Neuroscience | MIT OCW - Introduction to the mammalian nervous system, with emphasis on the structure and function of the human brain.

Resources / Newsletters

  • On The Brain - Harvard Mahoney Neuroscience Institute's quarterly e-newsletter.
